channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Power of Clicks, Likes, and Shares: Promote the Right Kind of Financial Content
item.description: Not all financial content creators on social media are created equal. A broad differentiation can be made between influencers, knowledge sharers, and aspiring thought leaders.

item.title: Trump lawyers accuse former fixer Michael Cohen of lying to jury
item.description: Whether the defense is successful in undermining Cohen's testimony could determine Trump's fate in the case.

item.title: Why the New T+1 Settlement Cycle Matters: A Global Index Provider’s Perspective
item.description: Shorter settlement periods are meant to protect market participants. But the new T+1 settlement cycle for US equities may have undesirable knock-on effects for financial market participants around the world, including index fund managers.

item.title: Sir Richard Branson—who hates being called a billionaire—sees net worth fall back to 2000 levels
item.description: Branson took a $126 million hit to his fortune last year as he continued to fight several fires at his Virgin Group.

item.title: Leveraging AI to Identify and Predict Financial Crises
item.description: Despite some current limitations, AI stands to offer significant advantages versus traditional approaches to identifying and predicting financial crises.

item.title: A deepfake ‘CFO’ tricked the British design firm behind the Sydney Opera House in $25 million fraud
item.description: “Our financial stability and business operations were not affected," an Arup spokesperson said.

item.title: Why Your Portfolio Should Include Scarce Assets
item.description: Portfolios that include both productive and scarce assets can deliver similar performance to the S&P 500 with less risk than those that hold only productive assets.

item.title: Taiwan is now exporting and investing more in the U.S. than China in major pivot away from Beijing
item.description: The U.S. displaced mainland China as the top destination for Taiwan’s exports in the first quarter of the year for the first time since the start of 2016, when comparable data became available.

item.title: Coiled Tight: Smaller Companies Are Primed for Outperformance
item.description: Small-cap companies are poised for a rebound. The sector is best approached through an active investment strategy where expertise and a deep understanding of the individual businesses and their risk-and-reward characteristics are necessary for success.

item.title: Nearly half of Gen Z and millennial workers have left a job, or plan to, because of climate concerns
item.description: Instead of sitting with their climate change anxiety, Gen Z and millennials are trying to save the planet by quitting jobs that aren’t eco-friendly.
